definition: to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb
palm of the hand/sole of the foot/paw/horseshoe/to slap/to hold in one's hand/to wield

sentences.english: In the original director Hayao Miyazaki keep Hosoda took over as director after the sudden departure.
sentences.chinese: 宮崎駿在原本導演細田守突然離職之後接掌擔任導演。

sentences.english: The vice-president took over the leadership of the country.
sentences.chinese: 副總統接掌了國家領導權。

definition: to take over (as minister, manager etc)
to succeed sb in a job/successor
in charge (of a position etc)/the person in charge/responsible
to take office/to assume a post
to wield (political etc) power/be in power
to replace/to take over (a position or post)
to ask sb to resign from a post
direct line of descent/under one's personal command/school or faction passing on faithfully one's doctrine
